pullRequest.title: SAMZA-2402: Tie Container placement service and Container placement handler and validate placement requests
pullRequest.bodyText:
Design: SEP-22: Container Placements in Samza
Changes: Following abilities are added as a part of this PR:

Container placement service is now tied with Container Placement Handler for dispatching container placement requests
Ability to queue actions is added along with de-queuing if there is already a pending in-flight request
Container placement request validation is added which includes deleting actions from the previous deploy (identified by app.run.id) and maintaining a cache of already taken actions so the action is not acted upon twice since underlying metastore is eventually consistent
Dispatching periodic responses to status changes in the placement action, a message is dispatched to metastore on a status update
Logging is improved to ensure we can grep everything related to an action by its UUID

Tests:

Integ test & Unit tests are added to moc and end to end message dispatching behavior, deletion of requests from previous deploy & duplicate request queuing
Manual testing matrix: Container Placement Test Plan

API Changes:

This PR introduces behavior changes when a container placement action is written to metastore and is read by JobCoordinator (JC), it will try to reserve resources for the request, if it gets the resources it attempts to stop the active container then attempts to start the container on the allocated resources.
Each placement request is identified by a UUID which is generated and given to a client on issuing a control command
Responses for each placement action can be queried by directly queueing meta-store by UUID
All the state related to control actions are maintained in memory in the JC, followed up by reporting & cleanup as soon as the control action finished

Upgrade Instructions: None
Usage Instructions: Instantiate ContainerPlacementMetadataStore to write Container placement messages to Metastore, query it by the UUID generated

nodes.bodyText:
What does this method do?
What does it return and in which conditions does it return which output?
Not sure what does " Action is supposed to be queued" mean?

What if the machine bearing the AM fails at line 311,
will the action be silently deleted/dropped?
Should the cache be updated before deleting from persistent store?

Is there a specific need for this?
Shoudnt ANY_HOST be the default, while if I want to be able to send a stateless job's container to a specific host, it should rather be allowed.

For a method that is called validatePlacementAction a return value of null/empty means the action is valid?
seems like weird semantics.

This class doesnt seem warranted, delete perhaps?
On a side note, if its accessed by a single thread it doesnt need to be a concurrent-queue.

nodes.bodyText:
This is really a BoundedLinkedHashSet, the fact that we're using it as a fifo cache is irrelevant.
We should call it a BoundedLinkedHashSet; which I think will be useful for other purposes, e.g., storing control actions in autosizing.
